etymology.description: 陈(陳 ‘aged; to display’) + 皮(‘peel; skin’) = aged peel (dried tangerine peel).
etymology.interpretation: Literally “aged peel,” referring to tangerine peel that is stored and aged to enhance aroma and medicinal efficacy. Emphasizes using old peels rather than fresh ones.
etymology.simplification: 陳 → 陈 by simplifying the component 東 to 东 within the character; 皮 unchanged.

parts.english: to display; to state; old/aged; surname

examples.chinese: 他用陈皮煮汤(他用陳皮煮湯)，味道更香(味道更香)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng chénpí zhǔ tāng, wèidào gèng xiāng.
examples.english: He cooks soup with dried tangerine peel, and the flavor is more fragrant.

examples.chinese: 中医常用陈理气化痰(中醫常用陳皮理氣化痰)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyī cháng yòng chénpí lǐqì huà tán.
examples.english: Traditional Chinese medicine often uses dried tangerine peel to regulate qi and resolve phlegm.

examples.chinese: 晾干的橘子皮陈放多年(晾乾的橘子皮陳放多年)，成陈皮(成陳皮)。
examples.pinyin: Liàng gān de júzi pí chén fàng duō nián, chéng chénpí.
examples.english: Dried mandarin peels are stored for years to become aged tangerine peel.
